sources.title: Hollywood Revue of 1929 (MGM) JOAN CRAWFORDüçï ALL-STAR EXTRAVAGANZA
sources.description:
PizzaFLIX Presents CLASSIC MOVIE MONDAY
Masters of Ceremony: Jack Benny, Conrad Nagel
Stars: John Gilbert, Joan Crawford, Buster Keaton, Norma Shearer, Laurel & Hardy
Director: Charles Reisner, Christy Cabanne, Norman Houston
üçïFEATURED HIGHLIGHTSüçï
0:00            PizzaFLIX Intro
07:17          "Got a Feeling for You" Joan Crawford 
20:18          "You Were Meant for Me" Conrad Nagel, Anita Page, Charles King
31:59          "Cut Up" comedy skit featuring William Haines & Jack Benny
34:12          "I Never Knew I Could Do a Thing Like That" Bessie Love
43:59          "Magic Act" introduced by Jack Benny, featuring Laurel and Hardy
01:07:20    "The Dance of the Sea", an "underwater" sequence performed by Buster Keaton
01:24:14    "Romeo and Juliet" (Technicolor) John Gilbert and Norma Shearer
01:31:00    "Singin' in the Rain" Ukulele Ike & The Brox Sisters
01:49:38    "Orange Blossom Time" (Technicolor) Charles King to Myrtle
01:56:39    "Singin' in the Rain" (finale) (Technicolor), sung by the entire cast

Step into the dazzling early days of talking pictures with this all-star musical extravaganza from Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, produced by Harry Rapf and directed by Charles Reisner. A landmark in film history, this 1929 variety-style revue showcases MGM‚Äôs top talent in a lively celebration of sound-era innovation, filmed in early two-color Technicolor sequences.

Featuring a stellar ensemble cast including Joan Crawford, Buster Keaton, Norma Shearer, John Gilbert, Marion Davies, Lionel Barrymore, Laurel and Hardy, and many more, this production offers a rare glimpse of silent-era stars adapting to the new world of sound. Musical highlights include ‚ÄúSingin‚Äô in the Rain,‚Äù performed by Cliff Edwards, as well as show-stopping dance numbers, comedy sketches, and operatic performances that marked a cinematic turning point.

üé≠ Subscribe for more Oscar-winning films, vintage musicals, and Pre-Code Hollywood gems!

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

With Conrad Nagel and Jack Benny serving as charming masters of ceremonies, this film delivers nonstop entertainment and historical significance. A must-see for fans of classic Hollywood, early musicals, and the dawn of the talkie era.
